result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Peter K. May was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: and retroactive to any administrative suspension

miscConds.notes: Fine and costs $1,719 to be taken from money on bond. Remainder to be applied to atty fees. If a balance of atty fees remain, def will continue to pay $100 a week until paid in full.

May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms

May not be in any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
Maintain absolute sobriety to include no possession or consumption of alcohol, illegal drugs, intoxicating substances, or any other controlled substances without a valid prescription. 
No operation of any motor vehicles unless properly licensed.

Continue using Soberlink
Enter into, participate in and successfully complete any assessments, evaluations and/or treatment programs as directed by the agent, including, but not limited to, AODA treatment.
Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge
If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: With good time and huber release if in compliance with jail rules and regulations. 60 days credit.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
